titles.title: For the relief of Oscar Salas-Velazquez.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 104-810.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 9.

action.text: Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.

vote.text: On passage Passed by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/23/1995--Introduced. Prohibits the Attorney General from disapproving a named individual's petition for classification as an immediate relative, or application for adjustment of status to that of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence, on the grounds that his marriage to a named individual was entered into in order to evade U.S. immigration laws.
